intro: Andersonia cucullata, commonly known as the hooded bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant features a compact, evergreen shrub with hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It blooms in spring and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Andersonia cucullata prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
